security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with grant writing guidance. No executable code, no network calls, no file system modifications beyond reading reference materials. Static findings are false positives triggered by documentation content about cybersecurity, URLs to federal agencies, and research methodology descriptions.

content.value_statement: Writing competitive research grants for federal agencies is complex and time-consuming. This skill provides agency-specific guidance, templates, and best practices for NSF, NIH, DOE, and DARPA proposals.
actual_capabilities: Provide agency-specific guidance for NSF, NIH, DOE, and DARPA proposals
Offer templates for Specific Aims pages, Project Summaries, and Budget Justifications
Explain review criteria and scoring rubrics for each funding agency
Guide broader impacts and significance statement development
Help plan project timelines, milestones, and management strategies
Provide resubmission strategies for rejected proposals
limitations: Cannot access external grant databases or verify current funding opportunities
Cannot submit proposals or interact with agency portals directly
Cannot provide institution-specific budget rates or compliance requirements
Cannot generate citations or access external literature databases

use_cases.title: First NSF or NIH proposal
use_cases.description: New investigators learning grant structure, review criteria, and best practices for first submissions.

use_cases.title: Strengthen existing proposals
use_cases.description: Established researchers refining innovation narratives, broader impacts, and resubmission strategies.

use_cases.title: Multi-agency strategy
use_cases.description: Teams evaluating which agencies best match their research and planning coordinated submissions.

prompt_templates.title: Draft first aims page
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write an NIH Specific Aims page for a [research area] project. I am applying to [NIH Institute] for an R01. My preliminary data shows [key finding].

prompt_templates.title: Craft broader impacts
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me develop substantive broader impacts for my NSF [program name] proposal. My research focuses on [topic]. I have access to [institutional resources].

prompt_templates.title: Compare agencies
prompt_templates.prompt: Should I submit my [research area] proposal to NSF, NIH, DOE, or DARPA? Compare review criteria, funding levels, and success rates for each.

prompt_templates.title: Address reviewer feedback
prompt_templates.prompt: I received these reviewer comments on my [agency] [grant type] submission: [quotes]. Help me craft a response and revise my proposal.

best_practices: Start 3-6 months before deadline to allow time for feedback and revision
Address review criteria explicitly in your proposal narrative
Get feedback from colleagues outside your field to improve clarity
Include preliminary data demonstrating feasibility of your approach
anti_patterns: Assuming reviewers know your field well enough to fill in gaps
Neglecting broader impacts or treating them as an afterthought
Proposing work that exceeds timeline or budget constraints
Vague objectives without specific, measurable outcomes

faq.question: What is the difference between NSF and NIH proposals?
faq.answer: NSF requires equal attention to Intellectual Merit and Broader Impacts. NIH emphasizes Specific Aims and Research Strategy with significance, innovation, and approach criteria.

faq.question: How long does it take to write a competitive proposal?
faq.answer: Plan for 3-6 months. Allow time for team coordination, preliminary data collection, internal review, and multiple revision cycles.

faq.question: Can this skill help with budgets?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides budget justification templates and guidance. You will need your institution's specific rates for salary, overhead, and fringe benefits.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill that does not access files, networks, or external systems. Your research data stays on your machine.

faq.question: How do I handle a rejected proposal?
faq.answer: Study reviewer comments carefully. Address each concern substantively. This skill provides templates for response letters and revision strategies.

faq.question: Should I apply to multiple agencies simultaneously?
faq.answer: Often yes, but adapt each proposal to agency priorities. Coordinate timing to manage revision cycles and avoid conflicts of interest.
